meanings.definition: Regard or represent as perfect or better than in reality.
meanings.sent1: She idealized her favorite singer, believing he could do no wrong.
meanings.sent2: In movies, characters are often idealized to make them more appealing to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The children idealized their teacher, thinking she had magical powers.
meanings.sent4: The painting idealized the landscape, making it look like a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: Her memory of the vacation was idealized, making it seem like a dream.

meanings.definition: To make something seem better or more perfect than it really is.
meanings.sent1: He idealized his old car when trying to sell it, highlighting its best features.
meanings.sent2: Advertisers often idealize products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The chef idealized the taste of his new dish, but it turned out to be too salty.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent idealized the small apartment, making it seem spacious and luxurious.
meanings.sent5: The author idealized the protagonist, making him seem like a hero in every situation.
